articles.title: Over a Million Miles per Hour: NASA's Chandra Catches Pulsar in X-Ray Speed Trap - SciTechDaily
articles.description: A pulsar is racing through the debris of an exploded star at a speed of over a million miles per hour. To measure this, researchers compared NASA Chandra X-ray Observatory images of G292.0+1.8 taken in 2006 and 2016. Pulsars can form when massive stars run ou…
articles.content: This result may help explain how some pulsars are accelerated to such remarkably high speeds.The G292.0+1.8 supernova remnant contains a pulsar moving at over a million miles per hour. This image fea… [+5254 chars]

articles.title: Look up! See the moon shine near massive asteroid Vesta this weekend. - Space.com
articles.description: The pair will be visible to observers using a widefield telescope eyepiece.
articles.content:
In the early hours of Sunday morning (June 19) the waning moon will pass within a thumbs width of asteroid Vesta in the east-southeastern sky.
